data.title: Red Door
data.text: I eat here fairly often with my wife, friends, or colleagues. The food is always tasty, though the menu is limited and the kitchen runs out of listed dishes too often. Perhaps part of the issue here is the front porch and patio construction: maybe when the upgrade is complete, the manager can plan more accurately. As it is, the crowds are smaller than in the past because it doesn't look open from the street, so maybe a clearer sign telling people to go to the back door would help. There is a good selection of wine and enough beer variety.

data.title: Very dissapointed
data.text: I'm giving a two not because the food is not good, the food is very tasty. I'm giving a 2 because this is the third time i have asked for a dish and they were out of it. It is early enough that I don't understand why the run out of a dish so quickly. They need better planning. Then when I asked for the bricked chicken it was supposed to be a leg quarter but I only got a leg w an unknown side. Marcie our server was very nice and apologetic. It was not her fault!!!!  I'm just upset because the food taste good but they are always out of the dishes I order. It is a cool place, specially for Lakeland since we don't have many local restaurant. I will come back because I like to support local business and it is a cool place. I just want to get what I order when I order it.

data.title: Birthday takeout dissapointment
data.text: Was tired wanted something new and nice for b day at home.Got their deal of 2 entrees and bottle of wine may have been a small ap but if their was dont remember so couldnt have been too good.Dinner was shrimp and grits grits were weird consistency and runny.Shrimp was average.Wine selection not very good for a wine market and you have a choice red or white bottom brand ofcourse tasted terrible.Bought the truffle popcorn,yuck not executed properly,evenly on popcorn.Should have been better pcorn and fresher truffle oil less of it perhaps a light tossing in a fresh made truffle butter.N e ways lots of people outside very hangout spot in evening a few tables inside but empty.Pricey for upscale shtick they are pushing.

data.title: Great food every time!
data.text: I've dined at this restaurant numerous times, and it's always great with superb friendly service. Last night was no exception. We got there at 10 p.m. and the chef happily cooked us three awesome meals. Check out my pics - breakfast plate (chicken and waffles), rock shrimp and steak with kimchee. All delicious!!

data.title: Great place and service
data.text: Went with a fairly big group. Accommodated us no problem. Marcy waited on us. Had good knowledge of food and drinks. Had the hamburger of the week which was fantastic! Need better beer selection, but not a deal breaker. Owner came out and met us. Will go again.

data.title: Great find, great food, great atmosphere.
data.text: The Red Door is unique to Lakeland, FL.  The cuisine is top notch and the owners take pride in quality and attention to detail.  Everyone at our table enjoyed their meals.  I strongly recommend detouring off I-4 and going to this restaurant.

data.title: Really rich food, flavor-combat
data.text: The atmosphere is nice, but the few menu choices are all very, very rich. If you like a lot of sauces and seasoning, you'll probably enjoy it more than I did. The fried green tomatoes are perfect, but being stacked with pork belly and salty cheeses with more sauce is too much. I'm middle-aged and wondered if the powerful flavors were meant to appease a young crowd or wake up an old crowd; to me, it was very over-done.

data.title: You'll be glad you went through this door
data.text: Surprisingly great food. Casual atmosphere. Live music and a great time had by all! She ordered the lamb burger (medium rare) & I had the beer chicken. I can't tell you how much we enjoyed the food. It was amazing. And you know what? The homemade ketchup was incredible! You will love this hidden jewel. No kidding.

data.title: Great for a Date Night
data.text: The Red Door serves a solid selection of wine, craft beer, and unique food options. I recently visited for the first time and tried the Gnocchi, Roasted Bone Marrow, and Poutine. My favorite dish was the Gnocchi which was mixed with tender escargot, mushrooms, spinach, and topped with a fried egg. This was also the first time I had tried Bone Marrow. The marrow itself was creamy and had a nice fatty flavor; an enjoyable dish but not very filling. The dish also came with a side of tender braised pork and toasted crostini’s. The Poutine was flavorful with soft and crispy french fries, fresh asparagus, cheese curds, and topped with a fried egg. Overall, the Red Door is a wonderful place for a date night in Lakeland.

data.title: Perfect Date Night
data.text: Some of the best food in the area! Live music was very nice, great casual spot to hang out and enjoy an evening. Will be back!

data.title: Best outdoor dining in Lakeland
data.text: If the weather is good, eating outside at Red Door is wonderful for family fun. Mums and Dads get to enjoy flights of wine and everyone gets to enjoy their delicious menu.

data.title: Love the atmosphere
data.text: Meal for 4, food was pretty heavy as I guess it was a winter menu but great food, different from the chains like Ruby Tuesday etc. The chef even made me a vegan meal after asking if they could jut leave some meat ingredients out...most restaurants won't do that for you. Love the wine bar atmosphere and the laid back eclectic decor.

data.title: Family birthday dinner
data.text: Cute restaurant, simple menu, nice staff. 8 large plate items and 7 small plate items. You should really call ahead and ask what items are still available. We got there for 6:30 dinner on a Saturday night and two items, short ribs and fish and chips already gone. The fish and chips were sold out from Friday night. Need to learn how to replenish main menu items. So we moved on to other items on menu. Son ordered the steak, guess what they were sold out of that also. Come on, it's 630 on a Saturday and your down there items on the menu???  They were also out of an IPA beer! The hamburger was good for the price. Don't know about ribs and fish. But the steak at $28 is worth it.

data.title: Foodie place in Lakeland
data.text:
Excellent, creative food. Mixture of unique flavors.

Service is also great. They were attentive and helped guide us through the menu.

Indoor and outdoor seating. Outdoor is beautiful if the weather is right.

data.title: Small and Unique
data.text: We had some friends visiting from Ohio and wanted to go somewhere unique to Lakeland.  The inside is small but comfortable and welcoming, outside there is plenty of seating and it is dog friendly.  The menu is small but there was still a nice variety.  From chicken pot pie to escargot!  One of our friends always has the server surprise him and she did with the escargot.  He had never tried that before and he loved it!  It ended up being a highlight of their trip.

data.title: Unique and delicious
data.text: Great atmosphere, wonderful food. They will customize a meal too! Real personal touch.  The owner is very knowledgeable on wines and willing to share knowledge.

data.title: Best Brunch around
data.text: Red Door has a great dinner menu, but I think their Brunch is the best time to visit. Super creative menu with options so delicious its hard to choose.  Staff is always really nice.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Good food, service ok. I found a beard hair in my food. It's really odd that the guys here have facial hair, and I'm not talking trimmed nice looking facial hair it's very overgrown and messy. Call me crazy but I don't want food servers to have such overgrown hair when they are handling your lunch.

data.title: Doesn't live up to the hype
data.text:
It's a shame that a modern restaurant meant to appeal to hipster can't figure out the importance of good service.  I had called ahead and booked a reservation, along with a high chair for my Mother's Day brunch.  I arrived and was told that I had to sit outside and that they didn't have high chairs.  Neither of these details were shared with me while making the reservation.  We stayed, since we had gone through the trouble of finding parking during MayFaire. We ordered the chicken waffles and it was pretty good, but nothing extraordinary.  My fiancé was served before me and my food took an extra 10 minutes to arrive.  
I then, walked inside to use the restroom, only to find an empty dining room.  There were empty tables everywhere!  
I love trying new places and had really high hopes for this one, but it was such a disappointment.

data.title: Go on a regular weekend.
data.text:
Just returned from Mayfaire Art Festival in Lakeland Fl.  Made a point to have lunch at Red Door since we had heard great things about it.  Unfortunately, because of the festival traffic they had a very limited special menu- only a few sandwiches, a couple of salads and hot dog/burgers on the outside grill. My BLT (flavored bacon, lettuce and fried green tomato) on buttery Texas toast was really good.  Served with cheese sprinkled kettle chips and with the blueberry ale I ordered - yum!  The rest of our party ordered burgers from the grill which were all burned and came without the side chips listed on menu.  Staff was pleasant and atmosphere is really adorable.  
Would I go back-absolutely but not on festival weekend.   A special occasion or weekend trip would be my suggestion to get the real experience.
